name: harp
definition: An instrument having an upright triangular frame consisting of a pillar, a curved neck and a hollow back containing the sounding board, with strings of graded lengths.
description:
The harp is a stringed musical instrument which has a number of individual strings running at an angle to its soundboard, which are plucked with the fingers.

Harps vary globally in many ways. In terms of size, many smaller harps can be played on the lap, while larger harps are quite heavy and rest on the floor.

Harps are usually between two feet and six feet in height. They usually have between 1 and 90 strings.

The three main parts of a harp include the neck, the sound box, and the strings. Different harps may use strings of catgut or nylon, or of metal, or some combination.

Harps can have a pedal which can help to raise the pitch of a string.

The electric harp is a relatively new invention. These harps can be hollow body or solid body depending on the design.

The harp can be heard in a variety of music styles including classical, orchestras, Celtic, African, rock, bluegrass, country, folk, jazz, and many more.

facts.name: The harp is one of the world's oldest instrument
facts.value: The harp is considered to be one of the world's oldest musical instruments.

facts.name: Some harp frames have a body
facts.value: Some harp frames have a body that was carved from one single piece of wood. Some harps on the other hand have as many as 2000 pieces.

facts.name: The blues harp
facts.value: The blues harp, Jew's harp, and Aeolian harp are not harps. They just have the word included in their name.

facts.name: In the 1600s when the English ruled in Ireland the harp was bann
facts.value: In the 1600s when the English ruled in Ireland the harp was banned and many were burned and the harpers were often executed.

facts.name: Famous harpists in history
facts.value: Famous harpists in history include King David, Turlough O'Carolyn, Francois-Joseph Naderman, Elias Parish Alvars, Alphonse Jean Hasselmans, Henriette Renie, Carlos Salzedo, Marcel Grandjany, and Harpo Marx.

facts.name: Famous modern harpists
facts.value: Famous modern harpists include Loreena McKennitt, Jon Anderson, Joanna Newsom, Ursula Holliger, and Kennerly Kitt.

facts.name: Glissando is when sweeps hands across the strings
facts.value: When a harpist sweeps their hands across the strings this technique is referred to as glissando.

facts.name: Arpeggio is when a harpist plays rapidly
facts.value: When a harpist plays rapidly this technique is referred to as arpeggio.

facts.name: The harpist uses only the first four fingers when picking
facts.value: When picking, the harpist only uses the first four fingers on each of their hands.

facts.name: Common western harps
facts.value: Common western harps include the Celtic or Irish folk/lever harp, the concert, pedal, or classical orchestral harp, the South American harp, the multi-course/row harp, and the renaissance or gothic harp.

facts.name: Africa is home to some of the largest varieties of harp
facts.value: Africa is home to some of the largest varieties of harp designs in the world.
